text: For some reason this song does not supply my mind with ease and calmness, relaxation. On the contrary, it gives me a rising sensation of tension and sudden danger. A feeling of haunting and scare... A somber feeling of post-futurism loneliness and nostalgia to the organic times. A whale in the android's stomach.

text:
I'd like to think this guy is like Quentin Tarantino for video games. The guy behaves like an ass, doesn't watch what he says, and generally comes off as unlikable...
But you can overlook it for the creativity and quality that he produces. Personally I'm not big on Fez, but I recognize that it's a very high quality and unique game.

text: I agree with you, but I don't like Phil's attitude towards the other indie devs. Cave Story will still remain the best indie game ever made, and Fez can't come near it.
author: Happytreefriendsfan3

text: I said I had a good feeling about this game before its release and I can say it was indeed an excellent game. It provided me with a completely unique experience that actually went beyond just playing a video game. The soundtrack is equally unique and amazing, it manages to feel organic with its electronic synths. Listening to Fez's music feels like going to a mental spa. This is probably my favorite track, awesome flow (aptly titled) and progression. Straight to the Relaxin' playlist.
author: SupraDarky
